Text.val: Create the records that will be displayed.
This is a typical block loop for processing the choices the user made.
Instead of a verify operation, you would probably call some other task to store a record

Text.valUnicode: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}} {\colortbl ;\red0\green0\blue0;} {\*\generator Msftedit 5.41.15.1515;}\viewkind4\uc1\pard\cf1\b\f0\fs20 You can allow the user to select multiple items at one time from a selection list box. A multiple selection list is set up in the same way as a single selection list box, except in the Control Properties:\par \par \bullet Selection Mode = Multiple\par \bullet The Data property points to a vector\par \par In this example, you can hold down CTRL and click on several items. When you press the Check button, you will get one message for each choice you selected. \par \par In production, you would do some logic instead of giving a message, but the process is the same.\par }

ExpSyntax.val: 'HG32: How Do I Retrieve Data from a Multiple Selection List Box?'

Text.val: If a numeric is attached, add it to the description so it shows to the user on a choice list
